intro: Macrosema flaccidus, commonly known as the flaccid mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on a variety of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its leafless stems and fleshy, sticky berries. The plant lacks true leaves but has scale-like structures that perform photosynthesis. It relies on its host for water and nutrients while contributing to the ecosystem through seed dispersal by birds. Its presence can impact the health of its host tree and influence local biodiversity.
